memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &accelerationOfNonInertialReferenceFrame, const Eigen::Vector3d &angularVelocityOfNonInertialReferenceFrame, const Eigen::Vector3d &angularAccelerationOfNonInertialReferenceFrame, const Eigen::Vector3d &positionOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame, const Eigen::Vector3d &velocityOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame)
memberdef.name: computeApparentAcceleration

briefdescription.para: Compute apparent acceleration due to non-inertiality of reference frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes apparent acceleration experienced by an object, of which the position and velocity are provided in a non-inertial (i.e. rotating and/or accelerating) reference frame. The apparent acceleration of a particle due to the non-inertiality of the reference frame in which its state is given, is given by following equation: \[ \boldsymbol{a}_{apparent} = -\boldsymbol{a}_B - \dot{\boldsymbol{\omega}} \times \boldsymbol{r}_{ni} - \boldsymbol{\omega} \times (\boldsymbol{\omega} \times \boldsymbol{r}_{ni}) - 2(\boldsymbol{\omega} \times \boldsymbol{v}_{ni}) \] where $\boldsymbol{a}_B$ is the acceleration of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame, $\boldsymbol{\omega}$ is the respective rotation rate and $\boldsymbol{r}_{ni}$ and $\boldsymbol{v}_{ni}$ are the object's position and velocity vector in the non-inertial frame in which the apparent acceleration is computed.
accelerationOfNonInertialReferenceFrame
Acceleration vector of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame [m s^-2].
angularVelocityOfNonInertialReferenceFrame
Angular velocity vector of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame [rad s^-1].
angularAccelerationOfNonInertialReferenceFrame
Angular acceleration vector of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame [rad s^-1].
positionOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame
Position vector of body in the non-inertial frame of reference in which the apparent acceleration is computed [m].
velocityOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame
Velocity vector of body in the non-inertial frame of reference in which the apparent acceleration is computed [m s^-1].
Apparent acceleration as seen by an observer in the rotating and accelerating frame.

briefdescription.para: Compute centripetal acceleration due to non-inertiality of reference frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes centripetal acceleration experienced by an object, of which the position is provided in a rotating reference frame. The centripetal acceleration of a particle due to the non-inertiality of the reference frame in which its state is given, is given by following equation: \[ \boldsymbol{a}_{centripetal} = -\boldsymbol{\omega} \times (\boldsymbol{\omega} \times \boldsymbol{r}_{ni}) \] where $\boldsymbol{\omega}$ is the rotation rate of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame and $\boldsymbol{r}_{ni}$ is the object's position in the non-inertial frame in which the apparent acceleration is computed.
angularVelocityOfNonInertialReferenceFrame
Angular velocity vector of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame [rad s^-1].
positionOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame
Position vector of body in the non-inertial frame of reference in which the apparent acceleration is computed [m].
Centripetal acceleration as seen by an observer in the rotating frame.

briefdescription.para: Compute Coriolis acceleration due to non-inertiality of reference frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes Coriolis acceleration experienced by an object, of which the position is provided in a rotating reference frame. The Coriolis acceleration of a particle due to the non-inertiality of the reference frame in which its state is given, is given by following equation: \[ \boldsymbol{a}_{Coriolis} = -2(\boldsymbol{\omega} \times \boldsymbol{v}_{ni}) \] where $\boldsymbol{\omega}$ is the rotation rate of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame and $\boldsymbol{v}_{ni}$ is the object's velocity in the non-inertial frame in which the apparent acceleration is computed.
angularVelocityOfNonInertialReferenceFrame
Angular velocity vector of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame [rad s^-1].
velocityOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame
Velocity vector of body in the non-inertial frame of reference in which the apparent acceleration is computed [m s^-1].
Coriolis acceleration as seen by an observer in the rotating frame.

briefdescription.para: Compute Euler acceleration due to non-inertiality of reference frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes Euler acceleration experienced by an object, of which the position is provided in a rotationally accelerating reference frame. The Euler acceleration of a particle due to the non-inertiality of the reference frame in which its state is given, is given by following equation: \[ \boldsymbol{a}_{Euler} = - \dot{\boldsymbol{\omega}} \times \boldsymbol{r}_{ni} \] where $\dot{\boldsymbol{\omega}}$ is the rate of change of the rotation rate of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame and $\boldsymbol{r}_{ni}$ is the object's position in the non-inertial frame in which the apparent acceleration is computed.
angularAccelerationOfNonInertialReferenceFrame
Angular acceleration vector of the non-inertial frame with respect to an inertial reference frame [rad s^-1].
positionOfBodyInNonInertialReferenceFrame
Position vector of body in the non-inertial frame of reference in which the apparent acceleration is computed [m].
Euler acceleration as seen by an observer in the rotationally accelerating frame.

briefdescription.para: Get rotation from planet-fixed to inertial frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Retuns rotation from planet-fixed to inertial frame, assuming that the equatorial plane is not equal to x-y plane of inertial frame. Orientation of body-fixed frame is obtained from right ascension and declination of body's pole and the location of the prime meridian (Seidelmann et al. 2005).
declinationOfPole
Declination of body's pole in inertial frame.
rightAscensionOfPole
Right ascension of body's pole in inertial frame.
longitudeOfPrimeMeridian
Longitude of body prime meridian.
Rotation quaternion computed.

angleFromXItoXR
Angle between X-axis of the planetocentric reference frame and X-axis of the inertial reference frame in [rad]. This angle is same as the rotational rate of the central body [rad/s] times the time from epoch [s].
Inertial (I) to planetocentric reference frame (R) transformation matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector6d &vehicleState, const Eigen::Vector6d &centralBodyState=Eigen::Vector6d::Zero(), const bool doesNaxisPointAwayFromCentralBody=true)
memberdef.name: getVelocityBasedLvlhToInertialRotation

briefdescription.para: Get rotation from velocity based LVLH frame to inertial (I) frame.

detaileddescription.para: Get rotation from velocity based LVLH frame to inertial frame (I) frame.

Returns rotation from inertial (i) to the velocity based LVLH frame. The velocity based LVLH frame is a right-handed orthogonal frame defined as follows: x-axis tangent to the velocity direction, y-axis in the orbital plane and pointing inwards (if doesNaxisPointAwayFromCentralBody is false), i.e. to the left when looking in velocity-direction, z-axis normal to the orbital plane.
vehicleState
State of the vehicle for which the LVLH frame is to be computed.
centralBodyState
State of the central body w.r.t. which the LVLH frame is to be computed.
doesNaxisPointAwayFromCentralBody
Boolean denoting whether the local y-axis points away from (if true) or towards (if false) central body.
Velocity based LVLH to inertial (I) frame transformation matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > &vehicleStateFunction, const std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > &centralBodyStateFunction, bool doesNaxisPointAwayFromCentralBody=true)

spacecraftKeplerianState
containging the following elements: semi-major axis -> not used eccentricity inclination argumentOfPeriapsis longitudeOfAscendingNode trueAnomaly

memberdef.name: getInertialToPlanetocentricFrameTransformationMatrix

briefdescription.para: Create a Quaterniond rotation state object from four quaternion values in vector 4d.

detaileddescription.para: Create a Quaterniond rotation state object from four quaternion values in a Vector4d.

Creates a Quaterniond rotation state object from four quaternion values. This function is not related to any specific rotation matrix, but can be used for general purposes. It's an eigen library transformation and can be applied directly to a vector Vector_new = Quaternion * Vector_old. Note that is also possible to create a quaternion object directly from a Vector4d, but Eigen will rearrange the order of the coefficients ([q2 q3 q4 q1]). This function retreives the individual entries of the Vector4d an uses them as four doubles as input arguments for the constructor of the Quateriond. From the Eigen code documentation:
Note the order of the arguments: the real w coefficient first, while internally the coefficients are stored in the following order: [x, y, z, w]
vectorWithQuaternion
A vector containing the quaternions of the rotation state
Transformation quaternion.

briefdescription.para: Get transformation matrix from Planetocentric (R) to the Local vertical (V) frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the frame transformation matrix from the Planetocentric (R) to the Local vertical (V) reference frame. The Z-axis is aligned with the local gravity vector. Whether or not, this is in the direction of the center of the central body, depends which kind of latitude is provided (geocentric, geodetic, gravitation latitude). The X-axis is directed to the north.
longitude
The longitude in the planetocentric reference frame in [rad].
latitude
The latitude in the planetocentric reference frame in [rad].
Transformation matrix from Planetocentric (R) to the local vertical (V) frame.

briefdescription.para: Get transformation matrix from the TA/TG to the V-frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the frame transformation matrix from the trajectory frame (T) to the local vertical (V) reference frame. Depending on whether the flight-path angle and heading angle express the velocity relative to the rotating planetocentric frame or relative to the local atmosphere, the resulting rotation holds for the groundspeed-based trajectory (TG) or airspeed-based trajectory (TA) frame respectively.
flightPathAngle
The trajectory's flight-path angle, positive upwards, in [rad].
headingAngle
The trajectory's heading angle with respect to the North in [rad].
Transformation matrix from trajectory frame (T) to the local vertical frame (V).

The trajectory's flight-path angle, positive upwards, in [rad].
headingAngle

Transformation quaternion from trajectory frame (T) to the local vertical frame (V).

headingAngle

Transformation matrix from the local vertical (V) to the trajectory (T) frame.

headingAngle

Transformation quaternion from the local vertical (V) to the trajectory (T) frame.

briefdescription.para: Function to compute the derivative of a rotation about the y-axis w.r.t. the rotation angle.

memberdef.name: getBodyFixedCartesianPosition

briefdescription.para: Function to compute a body-fixed relative cartesian position.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to compute a body-fixed relative cartesian position
positionFunctionOfCentralBody
Position function of central body
positionFunctionOfRelativeBody
Position function of point of which body-fixed state is to be computed
orientationFunctionOfCentralBody
Function returning rotation from inertial to body-fixed frame.
Body-fixed relative cartesian position
